Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; dot and billet band between added white bands; below, three lotus buds in white outline with added red centres; exterior: surface partly lost; elaborate rosette; pre-firing dipinto inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.728 and 1924,1201.846. Cook and Woodhead (1952, pl. 34, 15) show the three sherds together as if they were joined at the time, but there is no trace of glue.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 64, pl. XXXIIII, no. 15)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pl. XXI, no. 742) (One of the sherds)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1965) (phase 2)
